frameDefinitions: The existence of a State_of_affairs is sufficient reason for taking an Action .
An Entity meets the pre-conditions for participating in an Event.
An Agent occupies a Role in some institution.
In this frame a State_of_affairs is prohibited (or allowed) by a Principle.
This frame is concerned with the likelihood of a Hypothetical_event occurring.
A Potential_hindrance or an Agent (via their actions) keeps an Event from taking place, or despite the possibility of prevent the Event, do not do so.
frameExamples: The underwater sequences <t>warrant</t> the price of the admission alone.
Conductor software gives us the hands-on <t>capability</t> to provide updates immediately
Chris <t>served</t> as chairman of the boardfor one year.
It is <t>likely</t> that he'll arrive late.
Rain <t>prevented</t> the ball game from taking place.
listRoleDefinitions: An Eventuality or an Entity that is taken to constitute sufficient reason for taking another <fen>Action</fen>.
An <fen>Action</fen> that is taken to be justifiable given the <fen>State_of_Affairs</fen>.
The <fen>Entity</fen> whose meeting or falling short of pre-conditions is assessed.
The <fen>Event</fen> that the <fen>Entity</fen> may participate in.
The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> is capable of the <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the entity that occpuies the <fen>Role</fen>.
The <fen>Role</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> occupies.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> served in the <fen>Role</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> served in the <fen>Role</fen>.
A moral, legal, or social norm which rules a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> to be inadmissible behavior or an outcome of behavior.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the prohibiting occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the prohibiting occurs.
The state of affairs or occurrence whose likelihood is assessed.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> is the force which keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from happening, or does not.
The <fen>Event</fen> is prevented from occurring by the <fen>Preventing_cause</fen> or the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the sentient being which keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from happening.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> or <fen>Agent</fen> keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from taking place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> or <fen>Agent</fen> keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from taking place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>A heavy contact to the opponent 's face</fex> may not merit just a verbal warning
White House voices doubts about Aristide's ability <fex>to govern</fex>

<fex>The Establishment Clause of the First Amendment</fex> plainly prohibits the
establishment of a national religion by Congress.
<fex>Rain</fex> is fairly unlikely today, I think.
There is a high chance of rain <fex>today</fex>.
There is a high chance of rain <fex>in Seattle</fex>.
